document_title: Nephrotic syndrome: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_name: hoi-chung-than-hu.json_3_Factors that can cause nephrotic syndrome
subsection_content:
Factors that increase the risk of nephrotic syndrome include: (2)
Suffering from certain diseases that affect the whole body such as diabetes, lupus, amyloidosis...; Long-term use of certain medications such as non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, antibiotics, etc.; Suffering from certain infectious diseases such as HIV, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, malaria...; Certain types of cancer.
People with lupus have a very high risk of developing nephrotic syndrome
